intro: Bupleurum ranunculoides proles telonense, commonly known as the Telonese buttercup, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and trifoliate leaves. Its flowers are yellow, with five petals, and it blooms in late spring to early summer. This species is often found in rocky or alpine habitats and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
